description.narrative: IR 2.5 Primary School Completion All girls and boys are motivated to stay in school and complete their primary education.

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents
Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Other activities for equitable access to quality education e.g. school feeding, school grants
Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of early learning / pre-primary education teacher training
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
Provision of skills development for adolescents (10-19 year-olds) (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of skills development for multiple age groups (including in temporary learning spaces)
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
System strengthening - community participation and social accountability, e.g. school management committees
System strengthening - curricula and learning materials design (excluding early-learning / pre-primary)
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
System strengthening for adolescent participation and civic engagement (including in humanitarian settings)
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education
United Nations Girls' Education Initiative (UNGEI) Secretariat

description.narrative: Other General Services support to civil society
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Uganda United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Uganda 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Uganda Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 2.5 Primary School Completion All girls and boys are motivated to stay in school and complete their primary education.
Number and % of primary schools in 75 target districts where VAC is regularly tracked and reported
Number and % of children in target districts brought back to school
Number and % of schools in target districts equipped with facilities to promote inclusive education
Completion rate for boys and girls in 75 target districts

actual.value: 2015:Completion rates improved for boys and girls from 52% (boys 55%, girls 48%) female) in 2009/10 to 72% (B 72.%, G 72%).
